ca.hullabaloo.util.text
Class AhoCorasickPhraseMatcher

java.lang.Object
  ca.hullabaloo.util.text.AhoCorasickPhraseMatcher
All Implemented Interfaces:
PhraseMatcher
public class AhoCorasickPhraseMatcher
extends java.lang.Object
implements PhraseMatcher

A phrase matcher that uses the Aho-Corasick algorithm to search for any number of phrases in an input string. Uses BreakIterator to split the words and Collator to compare so should work well for any language supported by Java.

Note: This class is meant to match multiple match strings against an input pattern. If you want to match a single phrase, look elsewhere.

This class is thread safe for multiple concurrent calls to match(String, PhraseMatchListener), after prepareTree() has been called an assuming no intervening calls to any of the set methods.

Method Detail

setCaseSensitivity

public void setCaseSensitivity(boolean caseSensitive)
Sets if this search should test with case sensitivity. Defaults to true.

After setting this you must call prepareTree()before searching.

Parameters:
caseSensitive - true if this search is case sensitive

setCollationStrength

public void setCollationStrength(int strength)
Sets the collation strength used by the underlying collator. For most languages you're better off calling setCaseSensitivity(boolean).

After setting this you must call prepareTree()before searching.

Parameters:
strength - must be Collator.IDENTICAL, Collator.PRIMARY, Collator.SECONDARY or Collator.TERTIARY
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - invalid strength

public void setLocale(java.util.Locale locale)
Sets the locale to use when searching.

After setting this you must call prepareTree()before searching.

Parameters:
locale - the local to use for this object.

setSearch

public void setSearch(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> searchForStrings)
Sets the search strings to search for. This collection must contain only Stringobjects, and will throw a ClassCastExceptionif any of the objects in this collection are not Strings.

After setting this you must call prepareTree()before searching.

Parameters:
searchForStrings - the locale to use for this object.
